Use case: Channel messages from citizens to their representatives
Description: www.writetothem.com helps citizens contact their elected representatives to pressure them on important issues and generally keep them accountable for their role in democratic representation

Use case: Use prediction markets for public policy planning
Description: Futarchy is a concept of governance where public officials establish possible metrics for social impact, and prediction markets are used to forecast which policies would have the strongest impact on those metrics. The public body would take action based on those prediction-market data points, using them as a sensor. Blockchain and DAO can contribute to making this concept reality.

Ushahidi, an open source platform that helps citizens, communities, and social-service organizations respond to crises and document inequalities. They have delivered 150k+ deployments, working across disaster relief, voting corruption, displaced persons, and more

Use case: Leverage an online-offline public consultation process
Description: vTaiwan is an online-offline consultation process which brings together government ministries, elected representatives, scholars, experts, business leaders, civil society organizations and citizens. The process helps lawmakers implement decisions with a greater degree of legitimacy. It has various touch points such as a website (vtaiwan.tw), a combination of meetings and hackathons along with the consultation process. vTaiwan is also an open space, it is a combination of time and space run by participants to work on cases brought in. Other consultations mechanisms exist elsewhere e.g. Estonia's citizenOS, UK's TalkLondon, Brazil's e-democracia and Mudamos, Israel's Lobby99, Sweden's Din Riksdag, Australia's YourSay, EU's European CItizens' Initiatives, France's "Madame Mayor, I have an idea", Iceland's Better Reykjavik, Belgium's CitizenLab, Argentina's DemocracyOS, Latvia's ManaBalls. (Source: Nesta UK)

Use case: Enable citizens to increase transparency, accountability, and community effectiveness
Description: www.mysociety.org is an NGO based in the UK whose technology is used in dozens of countries, to enable citizens so they can keep their institutions more accountable and informed. They do so by improving the user experience in doing things that democratic institutions are mandated to do, but often don't make it easy to happen - such as alerting public authorities or public officials about local problems, or requesting information from them.

Use case: Crowdsource the annotation of a citizen discourse corpus
Description: Granddebat.fr offers to the public the ability to weigh in on many social issues, by providing plain-text answers. To help the analysis, this project enlists the help of thousands of people who tag the contributions.
